attributes.action: Remove the requirement for schools to operate on a termly basis in favour of much smaller time periods in order to allow peak smoothing of infrastructure demand.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Congestion of infrastructure is achieved by limiting holiday dates by means of universal school term or factory closure dates. This system was originally designed thus to boost revenue for establishment businesses, like travel & leisure companies. If schools were open all year round they could accommodate more students without increasing congestion. Teachers could also be better paid without incurring any true cost.
Schools could have two timetable groups using an alternate fortnightly attendance. That is children would attend school every other fortnight (for one fortnight).

Family holidays and public & private amenities demand would be more evenly spread over the whole year. This would create less congested useage without artificially inflated peak time prices.
